page.title: 13Interview: a local resident
page.content: Mr. Cyril Williams interview continued. "The books we used to read were Masterman Ready, Coral Island and Little Duke. We had no school outings. There were books at school but not a proper library." For Christmas he recalled "I used to get a good meal but didn't get any presents, just a few nuts and an orange." For holidays in the summer "Sometimes I would go and stay with my gran. To get there we would go to Filleigh Station, get the train to Barnstaple then on the Lynton line for Blackmoor Gate Station." "If we went to market we used to walk. We used to buy toffees, ten a penny, old money, and also bullseyes and strips of liquorise."
